results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.

results.title: The End of the road
results.brief_description: Situated in the remotest part of Northern Alaska is the oil field of Prudo Bay. This film looks at the operations required to run this oil field and the harsh climatic conditions under which the workers carry out their specific tasks.
results.description: Situated in the remotest part of Northern Alaska is the oil field of Prudo Bay. This film looks at the operations required to run this oil field and the harsh climatic conditions under which the workers carry out their specific tasks.
